page.title: 06Timber Framed Houses
page.content: We walked to Mrs.Jefferies' and Mr.Badcock's houses, near Chequer's End, on the left. Mrs. Jefferies' is {original inside,}Mr.Badcock's{original {outside.}Both are several cottages knocked together. There were other houses like these on Gaddesden Row which have now gone, including school cottages. There was a timber house where the{Golden Parsonage}stands. There is a dry well 4.5m deep in Mrs. Jefferies' cellar. You can also see a smoke bay and{wattle and daub.}The daub was made of lime, cow manure, cow hair, straw, cat's and horse hair. There is a hinged flap of wood which covered the window hole. There were Roman numerals on the beams. The builders matched numeral to numeral when building the house. Part was built 400yrs.ago. One house has a {Queen beam}which holds the house up.
